Buona birra, profumo davvero particolare. Amaro molto persistente nella bevuta che però tende a diminuire molto nel retrogusto.
Birra colore dorato. Schiume abbastanza fine. Allolfatto note erbacce e di agrumi. Al palato riprende le stesse note manifestate allolfatto. Una birra interessante e molto beverina.
Mild hoppy nose. Pale creamy head. Slightly hazy pale golden color. Malty and hoppy taste.

Draft Half Pint at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London in Nov 2010 - Hazy Pale Orange in colour. Very Fruity; sour/bitter citrus grapefruit; citrus rind and peel; tangy, zesty. Malty; toasty malts. Very refreshing. Good fruity bitterness. Very drinkable. 
 (2010-11)

330 ml bottle. Pours a nearly clear golden with a quickly disappearing white head. The aroma is lightly hoppy, some citric notes, some grass. Medium body with a low carbonation and a light bitterness. Taste of pale malt, some hops. Not very exciting.
Een enorm lekkere geur. Troebelblond. De smaak valt mee, cytrus-achtige smaak. De geur is wel beter dan de smaak.
Bottle. great sensations in mouth with hops and carbonation. nice body and mouthfeel.
Tap. Straw yellow, opaque. Moderate dense white head. Stays. A: honey malts, floral & fruity hops. Similar taste. Light to medium body. Light bitterness. Quite good
Orange öl med ett kvardröjande vitt skum. Doft av maltighet, rostat bröd citrus och persika. I smaken tillkommer viss pepprighet och en citrusskalsbeska.

Barwa złocista, zamglona. Piana całkiem obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, zostawia niezły lacing. Aromat owocowy, są nuty cytrusowe, winogronowe, brzoskwiniowe. W smaku jest raczej słodowe, fajnie kremowe, są też nuty cytrusowe, goryczka jest niska, wysycenie średnie.
Aroma is hoppy and fruity, with a touch of spices. Flavour is quite bitter, dry, fruity. Nice beer but not cream ale.
the commercial description is apt, but this is a particularly good "a cream ale" complete with falling to pieces after it becomes warm but being rather good when cold and cool

From Decervecitas. In Teku glass. After dinner. Lemony citric hoppyness, very good in nose and mouth. Close to an APA with lighter and more carbonated (yet pleasant) zesty body that provides which I suppose is called the creamyness of the style. A great improvement over my previous only reference of the style (Malaqas Bootlegger)
Bottle. Light sour lemony aroma. Cloudy golden, offwhite lace. Dry grassy, lime-note. Medium light mellow body. Grain, citrus finish. Nice Belgian IPA.

Hazy golden with little white head. Aroma is orange, fizzy tablet, green stuff, raspberry. Taste is lots of smoky dry bitterness. Almost too much to be enjoyable. Some fruity sweet notes in the finish, long. Not bad.

(bottle) very hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of coconut milk and bretty funk, with a touch of cherry juice, some peanuts and chlorine. flavour is mostly cactus juice and grass, with a hint of flour, some light avocado and a herbal-hoppy medium-bitter finish. light- to medium-bodied with average carbonation.
Bottle. Golden color with white head. Aroma is oranges, grassy, slightly tart fruits. Taste is slightly tart, oranges. Medium carbonation, quite crisp. Quite nice.
Yellow color with foam layer. Milky nose. Bitter tart taste with a little boring body. Dry bitter aftertaste.

330ml bottle from Beer Gonzo. Pours hazy yellow, good white head. Aroma is lightly sweet malts. Taste is smooth with a prominent but well-integrated hop presence. Has a welcome underlying sweetness here and a low bitterness. Nice example of a Cream Ale.
Sample from draft. Poured hazy yellow with a white head. Nose of light malts, citrus, belgian yeast, zest and light spices. Creamy mouthfeel, yeast, and beaked bread

Light yellow, hazy body with creamy white foam. Aroma yeast, biscuit, citrus, orange, tangerine and grass. Very similar sensation in mouth. Slightly dry, with lemon zest and herbaceous notes. It is a beer fermented ale but at much lower temperatures than usual, so the output includes the body of an ale but the lightness of a pilsner.

I liked the mixing of lager and ale flavors. It was light in color and palate, a bit hazy and tasted lightly of malt and fruit. I didnt care for the high amount of hopping in the flavor. I selected a cream ale to avoid hopping so big disappointment there. There result was that it tasted more like an APA than something unique.

From a bottle. Quite a hoppy version of the style, very nicely made with a medium body.

Very clear notes of grain in Nose as well as taste.

Al palato buon erbaceo e floreale,qualche nota speziata e ala fine chiude con un bellamaro agrumato leggero (buccia darancia). Nice, easy to drink, no alcohol presence. Body is light but not too much. Smooth. Medium carbonation. Highly refreshing yet still flavorful. Not the most amazing style, but this one delivers enough flavor and aroma to make it interesting. Its too expensive to be sessionable.

Cream ales have been around for almost a century now, but the original North American examples almost never reached continental Europe and the style still remains largely unknown here, so I had to resort to this one to get to know it; since its Mikkeller, Im far from sure this is representative for the style. Anyway, from what I heard this is a very unambitious beer style, trying to emulate the pale lager style from a top-fermented viewpoint, not unlike the ordinary blondes in Belgium. Misty peach blonde colour under a medium but breaking, off-white, milky head; the head becomes more dense and moussy with deposit, and the colour deepens as well, to a cloudy orangey blonde. Aroma of gooseberries, freshly cut cucumber, straw, unripe peach, green apple peel almost as in a Duvel, white bread, grass and sorrel (acetaldehyde, probably), very vague hint of lemon peel or even white vinegar, touch of iron but not disturbing, bakers yeast and a very subtle apricot or pineapple sweetishness; just a little bit phenolic too. Crisp onset, fairly highly carbonated which I assume is the intention, restrained but still interesting and persisting sourish fruitiness (green apple, unripe pear, berries), smooth and medium body, pouring away easily, dry and a bit minerally with nevertheless a lightly bready pale malt sweetishness underlying, spicy Belgian yeastiness (which I assume is not typical at all for the style) increasing in the finish, somewhat chalky, with a medium, grassy and leafy, deep and medium long hop bitterishness, even turning piney and resinous to a certain degree, lingering along with a residue of the pale malts. In all: I unfortunately have no other cream ale to compare this with, but if I got it right, this is more yeasty and estery than would normally be the case in this style. Had I tasted this blind, I would have been unable to discern this from any ordinary Belgian blonde; both styles are clearly intended to profit from the pale lager revolution. This one (having been made in Belgium!) does not differ at all from many dryish Belgian blonde quenchers, so until I get my hands on a real American or Canadian example of the style for comparison, this remains a non-style to me. Still, by itself, this is not too unpleasant, and reading the other ratings here, I assume having a bottle of some age (past its best before date by a few months) has deprived it from a lot of its hop aroma - which I guess shouldnt even have been there in the first place, if the intention was to make a true cream ale...

À mi-chemin entre une Pilsner, une Lager et une blanche, cette bière à peu de choses pour me séduire. De couleur pâle et aux reflets de chambre dhôpital, cette bière sans mousse ne propose aux rien rien de bien appétissant. Une mousse timide se forme lors du service pour disparaître aussitôt. Décevant. La bière reste ainsi toute nue, immobile et sans même pouvoir se vanter davoir quelques bulles agitatrices qui attireraient notre attention. Au nez ça sent la gomme au raisin. Curieux pour une bière de ce type. Je perçois aussi (comme je le mentionnais plus haut) les arômes de levure Pilsner mais bon, le nez demeure sans complexité. En bouche, la gomme au raisin est encore présente. On goûte du sucre mais la bière noffre que ça. Un peu de malt caramélisé aurait conféré à cette bière un équilibre intéressant, mais bon, ce nest pas le cas. Je dois tout de même admettre quelle offre en bouche une effervescence inattendue, ce qui représente pour moi sa plus grande qualité. Bref, cette bière est sèche mais manque de corps, de bulles (cream ale, vraiment?) et de caractère. On est loin de vivre laction suggérée par létiquette.

Bottle at home. Pours clear golden yellow, nose is lemon, grassy, biscuit, taste is similar.

Au nez, floral avec des pointes dananas et farines des tropiques. Robe blonde, trouble au reflets doré et bulle plutôt épaisse sans être dense. Subtile en bouche: plutôt douce mais suffisamment complète. Belle finale sèche.

Tap. A fabulously crafted drinkable ale. Starts with a nice fruity taste evolving into a subtle hoppy bitterness. What I loved especially was the mix between the full body and the extreme freshness of its taste.

Tap @ basement beer bar. Aroma of some hops and straw. Hazy light amber with thick small white head, tiny lasting. Light+ bitterness, light if any sweetness. Smooth texture, light watery body, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a big creamy white head, aroma has light lemon, taste also has lemon along with some yeast and spice, viscous mouthfeel.

On tap at Beer Deluxe. Pours hazy orange. Grassy but heavily dampened nose, like something is blocking the aroma to come out. Slightly creamy texture, noticeable bitterness, a bit of hops, but nothing exciting in any way.

Bottle. Pours in light hazy pale body with low white head. Aroma has a gentle diacetyl profile, almost pop-corn like. Light earthy background. Taste has earthy bitterness with malty grainy background. Body has gentle carbonation with medium body. The DMS is pretty interesting in here, almost non existing in the aroma but has a light place in the taste. Interesting.

Presenta amarillo oro con generosa cabeza de espuma que presenta buena retención; aromas a plátano, limón, clavo y levadura; en boca entrada media con amargor equilibrado; siguen notas a lúpulo y flores, cuerpo ligero-medio con carbónico medio; pos gusto largo con amargor medio; curiosa cerveza ale con el final algo picante, nada extraordinaria pero fácil de beber.
Straw Yellow. Very little hazy. Big white Head. Malty, rich aroma. Creamy, smooth mouthfeel. Oranges, crisp, yeasty.
The aroma is full of amarillo hops, elderflower, honey and corn. The color is beautifully golden and yellow. A hazy liquid. The taste is full of amarillo hops, honey and corn. An excellent beer!

Bottle from hop hideout, sheffield. Murky amber with yeast particles and long lasting creamy white head. Aroma is lemon and orange zest, grapefruit. Taste is zesty tart and crisp bitterness. Medium body and carbonation.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Pours cloudy, with a loose bubbled fringe. A lot drier than what I anticipated. Yellower too. Balanced, spiky mouthfeel. Notes of Saison yeast. Dont really know what a Cream Ale is. But this is nice.

Bottle - 330ml. Cloudy golden body with a thin, white creamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with malty and mango hints. Its sharp hoppy taste carries coriander and citrusy notes. Ends with a long bitter/herbal finish. Very good.

pours cloudy very pale golden, grey tint, with a small white cap, not quite reviving or leaving any form of lacing - lets just say minimal but clearly lacking for a cream ale. spicy citrus - some peel, bready and crackery pale maltiness, some fruitiness - tangerines with a pineapple touch, dry honey, leafy grassy notes along with bitter herbs, hint of vanilla. light carbonation, light body - definitely creamy and smooth, balanced spicy-citrusy finish. creamy indeed. mild as suggested by style. remains pretty darn boring but drinkable.

Definitely not what i would have expected from cream ale, and in this case that is not a positive attribute. It tasted like IPA and had no creamy or oily texture that one expects from cream ale. Had some thickness to its texture, and overly low carbonation. Not a terrible after taste.
330ml bottle. Hazy golden body, medium white head, poor retention. Aroma of floral hops, citrus zest, herbs, yeast. Taste of herbal hops, yeast, grapefruit zest, lemon, a touch of mint. Ok.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2015 Pours lemon colour with an unstable head. Aroma is a balmy mixture of lemon, citrus, pineaple, sour orange and some yeast. In taste the beer is medium-bodied, refreshing with decent carbonation and short albedo bitterness. Citrus notes in the taste give it a very light and refreshing profile. Nothing extraordinary but nothing to complain about at the same time - a decent bottle of beer good for scorching summer days.

330ml bottle, slight cloudy honey gold hue, with a fluffy white head, light yeasty,doughy, lemon pie crust nose, with some light lemon, blood orange peel, faint honeyed pale, toasted, munich, toasted malt accents, and a faint floral citrus, leafy hop note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a mild bubblegum yeast, faint candyish grape lollipop, flowery leafy, grassy, minty, citrus hoppy character, with some faint lemon, grapefruit rind, lemon pie crust, lemon marmalade flavours, leading towards a doughy yeastiness, lemon, grapefruit citrus peel, lingering earthy leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

Dourado com espuma de baixa duração (copo caldereta). Aroma maltado e frutado (frutas amarelas) e no início tuti-fruti. No paladar repetiu os aromas evoluindo para somente malte. Um pouco de defumado. Amargor presente com boa acidez e carbonatação.

Dourada e translúcida com boa formação de espuma de média duração. Aroma um pouco frutado, com notas cítricas e discreto malte. O sabor é um pouco aguado com suave amargor. Corpo leve e final de média duração.
330 ml bottle. Pours a pale yellow colour with thin white head. Aroma is yeast, citrus, honey. Taste is citrus. Well balanced and refreshing.

Bière blonde pâle légèrement trouble, avec une mousse fugace en surface. Le nez est houblonné, elle rappelle à première vue une pilsner de style américain plutôt bien houblonnée. La bouche est simple, elle est assez mince, les saveurs (amertume fruitée, malts blonds) sont directes et franches, on est dans de la buvabilité extrême. Pas pour tous les palais, mais cette bière est étonnamment accessible et délicieusement désaltérante.
Bottle. Mild flavor, nice color. Good, but not too rich and interesting for me.

Pale yellow colour, rocky white head. Aroma of camomile, honey, yeast, lime, lemon. Taste is light sweet, slightly bitter. Well balanced and refreshing. Light body, slick to oily texture, average carbonation. Very drinkable

Bottle: Poured a light hazy yellow color ale with a large pure white foamy head with good retention and some light lacing. Aroma of light cereal notes is quite tame. Taste is also pretty tame with light cereal notes and smooth finish. Body is average for style with good carbonation. Not bad for style but really nothing that good to write home about.
bottle. Hazy golden colour and thick white head. Citrus and grapefruit hop aroma. Taste was a little bitter and harsh, heavy on hops and not enough malts. Ok.

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2015 Average and moderately cloudy golden color. A good White Cream lower duration and good time, but makes good ties on the walls of glass along the tasting.
The aroma is intense and pleasant with beautiful citrus notes, with cassis, fresh sliced ​​cucumber, green apple, some iron ring, bread baking, fresh white bread, vaguely reminiscent of Galician lemon peels in a small, though this phenolic feeling.
The taste is refreshing and slightly sweet in the beginning that immediately gives way to an increasing dryness in a long and bitter taste and Hop.
This being highly carbonated beer brings a great freshness that assuming that this is the intention, in a restrained, but still interesting and persistent fruitiness of green pears, green apples, apricots, a light white bread, malt clear the bottom closing with a spicy touch Belgian spices which in my view is not entirely framed in this style.
Medium to low carbonation with a medium to soft body, an oily texture, dry and slightly mineral.
The finish showed half long and oily texture as stated earlier, having a means say pulling right notes of grass and wooded. Well Hop. The final dates and malts pine resin or lacquer that join other waste of malts used.
The aftertaste jumped good with a lot of intensity, duration and very dry which asks another sip.
A refreshing beer and very good drinkability!
Hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is citrus, hops and mango. Taste is light bitter with notes of hops and exotic fruits.

Pours a hazy golden-yellow colour with a frothy white head, good retention and some foamy-bubbly lacing. Fruity aromas of grapefruit from the hops, with a blend of peaches and grass. There is also this hint of grape juice (vinous), which is also found in the taste. The mouthfeel is a little tarty and dry. Not sure about the style, but it has cracked corn. One of the hoppier cream ales I have had.
330 mL bottle. Pours cloudy yellow, with a thin white head. Citrus and fruit aroma. Semi creamy body, mostly citrus taste, orange, grapefruit, some light hop notes too.

Bottle from LCBO, Toronto. Pours murky with a little white head. Mild aroma of hops. Tastes of hop bitterness with hop and raisin in the finish. Monotone with hop bitterness dominating. A little disappointing.

Bottle @ home (from a tutta Birra). colore giallo ambrato, brillante, opalescente. Schiuma bianca, fine persistente, grande compattezza. Aroma fruttato, agrumato, piuttosto intenso. I toni secondari sono floreali e di miele. Semplice ma gradevole. Gusto abboccato allingresso, intenso, piuttosto amaro nel finale. Il retrolfattivo è addirittura erbaceo. molto corposa, poco carbonata, piena. Equilibrata ed armonica.

Bel color giallo intenso con poca schiuma di poca consistenza e compattezza, al naso si sprigionano sentori floreali primaverili, una dolcezza che si riscontra in ingresso in bocca, accompagnato da un filo di citricità che bilancia perfettamente il tutto. Chiusura appena amara che è un piacere, come è un piacere berla tanto è beverina grazie al corpo medio e giusta carbonatazione!!!

Fruits, citrus, hay and some floral hops in the aroma. yellow with a white head. Medium sweet and medium + bitter. Light to medium body with a average carbonation. Overall quite OK, not my favorite style, but enjoyable.
Bottle @ De Tolly Joogipood. Pours hazy golden with big frothy head. Aroma is sour, grapfruit, orange,soap. Taste is medium bitter, grapefruit, grass, pine,refreshing.Medium body. Good beer.
Pours cloudy yellow with small frothy white top. Aroma is milky, light citrus hops. Taste is creamy mouthfeel, subtle and delicate citrus hops and cereal malts. So nice.

2014/11/26 - Pours a hazy golden colour with a thick, soapy, white head. Aroma is grapefruit and orange citrus, mild pine, cat urine and pale cereal grain. Taste is similar to nose; cat urine, grapefruit citrus and bready notes. Mouthfeel is medium with lightly biting carbonation and a crisp, drying finish. Light and refreshing, but doesn't really taste like a cream ale.

Light body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Vinmonopolets BU. 4.9% ABV, not 5% (different beer?). Pours amber to orange. Below medium amount of white head. Citrus, lemongrass, orange and some seltzers flavour. Thin to medium body. Lots of stingy carbonation. Low sweet and bitterness. Feels a bit like a fruity session IPA, without the bitterness.
Una birra davvero semplice e sensazionale allo stesso tempo, davvero molto rinfrescante con ottime note maltate ben bilanciate dal corpo leggero e luppolato.

330ml bottle 
4.9% bv 
Queens Quay LCBO Outlet (Toronto, Ontario, Canada) 
November 21, 2014
Part of the 2014 Mikkeller Feature and the LCBO. The beer pours a hazed metallic gold with a white ring for a head. The aroma is grainy malt, light caramel, weak floral hops, and metallic notes. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with average carbonation. The flavour is grainy malt, some citrusy notes and weak caramel. This is a nice refreshing beer.
Golden pour with little head. Aroma is malty and amazing. Taste is malty with cereal notes. Mouthfeel almost perfect. Not much much to be said.

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Hazy deep golden with a rocky bright white head.
 
Aroma: Strong grapefruit hops, a bit of lemon and some cat pee, green bitter herbs, a little biscuit/bready malt, no corn to speak of...
 
Palate: Medium body, a bit slick with relaxed carbonation,
 
Flav.: The hop flavour is more resinous and dank, with much less citrus and still some cat pee; dry with fairly good bitterness and a pleasantly light malt and resin/citrus finish.

Hardly a Cream Ale...tasty nonetheless.
Una discreta cream ale arricchita da note leggermente agrumate e di pino. Un po acquosa. Ma sicuramente unottima bevuta, memorabile!
Hazy light golden colour, light body. Bit watery. Taste bready with some hops. Ok
Cloudyish golden color, huge white head. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, malt. Light sweet, light bitter taste. Light to medium body, average carbonation. Thin, flat and pretty disappointing.
330ml bottle. Cloudy gold with a frothy white head. Flavors are crisp pale cereals, bread, citrus and herbal hops with floral and soapy notes. Light body, moderate carbonation, smooth texture.
Bottle 0,33l, bought at Hoppiness in Koper (Slovenia). Pale hazy liquid with big head. Medium body and carbonation. Very strange aroma, cannot define it. Disappointing.

[Bottle (330ml)] Pours a cloudy, bubbly gold with an average size frothy off-white head. Minimal lacing. Aroma of wheat, grain, cereal malt, light fruit and very light grassy hops. Flavour of grain and cereal malt along with some fruit and a finish which is more bitter then expected. Average bodied. Overall its fine, but not something Id drink again, not my thing.
Mikkeller Cream ale has a very intense aroma of dry hops, it appears pale with a thin head. the taste is light-medium bitter, and the palate and finish is very dry!

330ml bottle from the Lcbo
big frothy CREAMY white head cloudy pale yellow
mild citrus aroma
pretty good
(bottle) hazy orange colour with a small off white head; aroma of stewed fruit, noble hops, hint of funk; balanced flavour with a long medium bitter finish

Pours mellow yellow with a ginger ale style fizz & topped with a thin slice of foam. Crisp & more complex than most cream ales, starts with a squeezed citrus sensation & moves to an almost cider like palate wash in the finish. Not bad. Works really well after drinking a sticky imperial stout. Reminds me of some local session pale ales that are sprouting up like mushrooms. Will buy more.

330 mL bottle. Pours hazy off yellow with a frothy head of white. Aroma is hoppy for a cream ale with light citrus and pine, an array of cereal tones, slightly doughy and a touch of metallic sulfur tang. Delightfully dry despite all those cereal overtones, with a slightly bitter finish. Light bodied with moderate carbonation. Inspired Cream Ale, would make a nice summer session beer.

Slightly hazy orange pour, with a big fluffy white head. A good cereal nose, with that typical apple aroma and flavour I find you get in cream ales. There hops are grassy and quite green. The finish is quite dry, not much going on, subtle hops, subtle grains. this to begin with is a pretty boring flavourless style, but this is a good tasty version.

Pours a nice golden hazy colour with a white foamy head. Has a sweet aroma, a bit of yeast. Great palate, lots of flavour up front, medium hops, tongue coating flavour, thin and sparkling, seems to dissolve into your tongue. Slightly sharp on the finish, good overall, interesting beer not your typical cream ale.

Bottle from Tallinna Kaubamaja (4,10). BB 01.2017. Label not the one with guns, ABV is 4,9. Pours a hazy golden colour with a white, retaining and lacing top. Nose is dominated by pale malts and backed by citrusy and resinous hops with a hint of spiciness. Bit weak. The hops leap forward as its warmed some more. Taste is very lean and clean with a good citrusy bitterness and a sweet malty character that balances it out, whereas finish is quite bitter. Body medium or slightly less, carbonation thin with a fizziness in the throat when swallowing. Palate dry and malty. Overall a very nice easy-drinking beer - would make a good potential turning point for macro-lager guys I imagine. I think this was my first ever Cream Ale so I cant put it into context.
Bottle from LCBO. Aroma of grain, grass, hay, and fruity floral hops. Taste is pleasantly malty, bitter, with citrus notes. Nice balanced ale.
Piney, catty hop aroma. Tastes frankly too hoppy for style, but it isnt out of balance. Finishes almost dry - slight corn sweetness at end.

So tell me my fellow Canadians, does your bottle have a Tommy Gun on it as pictured above, or has the temperamental, over-powered crybabies at the LCBO made him change the label. Mail me I honestly want to know. 

As for the beer. Pours a cloudy amber-gold, and I suspect I should have used a nicer glass than a tumbler to get the proper effect. The white head isnt significant and reduces to a spotty sheet quickly. Nose has decent malts, some citrus hops, and it seem a little sour grapefruit. Is this a soured beer? Lets find out. Nope, not soured, but there is a chucky amount of bittering hops in this fella, some citrus hops, and a softer hay malts that really dont stand up. Quite bitter on the aftertaste. Not finding this beer well balanced. The bitterness is dominating its poor malt sub, and everyone has forgotten the safety word. Not a bad beer, but not exceptional.

330ml from LCBO. pours a hazy golden colour. Weird aroma with floral hops, some yeasty notes and some hay. Medium to light body, fast profile, little in terms of flavour but the texture is there as is a slight bite on the finish. meh, this style of beer never did it for me.
Oct. 14, 2014. Bottle from LCBO. Opaque golden yellow with fluffy, pillowy white head. Lemon, hops aromas with hint of biscuit. Lemon, straw flavours with hop bite. Bitterness doesnt linger.

A hilarious no-guns nanny state ontario label. Pours cloudy with a good head. Fresh open sweet and hop aroma. Taste is pleasantly dry with nice grassy hop pale fruit accents, supremely drinkable. Its very funny Mik send our market Cream Ale because Ontario has been mentally delayed with beer styles behind the USA by a decade or two. That said this is very good.

330 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a lightly hazy golden colour with decent-sized white head. Aroma has effervescent flowers, citrus and some sweet, lightly grainy malt. Flavour has lively floral hoppiness, some citric character and even a little soapiness to go with an understated, modestly sweet malty backbone. Lightly drying finish. Not a classic cream ale, but nice.

MIneral, light leafy hoppyness and mildly sweet malt in the aroma. Smells refreshinig but very mild. Hazy yellow with a long lasting white head. Fairly hoppy upfront, again the leafy hops are evident, finishes very clean with not much flavor to talk of. The hops predominate this one completely, the malt profile is very mild. Decent but nothing mildblowing, refreshing and crisp. Average body and carbonation.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours hazy gold, with average head. Smells hoppy, pine, citrus, some toasty notes. Taste is pleasant, some citrus, stone fruit, mild bitterness, some sugary and grainy malt. Pretty good.

330 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours hazy pale golden with a moderate off-white head that fades to a thin remnant and leaves a small amount of fine lace. The nose has soft citrusy, floral hop notes paired with pale malts, grain and a touch of caramel. The flavour is slightly dry with pale, grainy malts up front matched with delicate hops that build through the middle towards a citrusy, slightly piney mildly bitter finish that lingers. There is also a touch of pale malt in the finish as well. On the palate, it is light in body with a dryish, slightly astringent texture and soft carbonation. Overall, a decent brew for what it is, a hop-forward cream ale. But it is not the most complex or interesting. 2014-10-15

Bottle from the LCBO. Hazy golden-yellow body with a small white head. Hop-forward aroma with strong citrus and floral/soapy notes over a light malt base. Flavour follows with nice punchy citrus hops supported by a simple, clean, lightly sweet malt backbone. As others have noted, its not a typical cream ale, but its still a very good beer, and is marked accordingly.

330ml bottle. Pours a pretty clear, opaque/orange with a half finger, whore head that quickly thins to a film. Aroma is slightly floral with nice notes of citrus, mild pine, bread, and a hint of caramel. Taste is balanced. Notes of resin, pine, citrus, and a bit of caramel/breadyness at the end. Medium body with a medium-high carbonation. Slightly resiny in the mouth with a frothy carbonation and semi-dry finish. Overall a bit like some APAs Ive had. Mild citrus, pine, and resin. Pretty easy drinking.
330 mL bottle. Hazy yellow. Doesnt seem particularly creamy. Its like a slightly hoppy golden ale. Not bad, but not terribly interesting.
Fresh bottle at LCBO. Good hop bitterness in finish. Nicely drinkable and unique. Lacy, creamy.

It pours straw yellow and hazy; the head is off-white and foamy with micro-bubbles. The aroma has notes of: hay, pineapple, heavy minerality, and a yeasty characteristic. The taste is quite dry, that finishes medium-heavy bitter and rounds out right at the end; there are notes of: lemon, grapefruit, alcohol, yeasty-notes, a slight cracker note, and a lingering vegetable note on the finish. The palate is light bodied, the carbonation is vibrant and with small bubbles, the finish in long and thin with a slight astringency. Overall, a very pleasant example of the style, suited to summer nights.
La mi mogliera, mi ha detto se gli compro una cassa perchè gli è piaciuta parecchio. In effetti ha una gran beva, e in bocca è molto morbida.

Bottle 33 cl.
Medium yellow, white head. Malt, citrus and hints of hops. Fruity sweet, with a long dry bitter finish.

Must admit that I had higher expectations.

Aroma: citrus notes, pine. Appearance: hazy straw color, nice white head. Taste: medium bitternes ( pine and resin ), grapefruit, herbal notes, smooth and dry. Palate: low body and medium carbonation, bitter finish. Overall: quite nice beer with a nice bitterness.

Bottle (from The Bottle Shop in Bratislava); pours a hazy gold with a white head; aroma is citrus and malt; taste is bitter citrus, malt and a hint of honey; has a light bitter and dry finish; not quite what I was expecting but still good.
Draft @ beer temple. Soft body of malt and grainy notes and indeed a nice creamy taste and mouthfeel. Not very aggresive, this is a modest beer. Smooth and solid.
Over all this is from what I can tell what a cream ale should be like. Its tasty fresh and not to full on. Nice but not a style that pushes boundaries. Nice beer.

The head is good, body brown and cloudy. It smells malty, sweet, fruity, bit bitter. Taste is malty, fruity(not bitter), citrus, less carbonated, little bit creamy, balanced, refreshing. OK not very special, but easy and nice drinkable.
A hint of pineapple but after that is just pure zesty bitterness. Looks like a Belgian blonde but tastes like bitterness-heavy APA.
33cl bottle at restaurant styrbjörn. Pours hazy golden with fruity aroma. Sweet fruity taste with citrus and orange.
Pours hazy pale yellow, small white head. Aroma is hops, a bit of grapefruit. Light body, Lively, tangy, and a bit sour/citrus.

Translucent orange-ish yellow withou little head. Aroma of citrus with a bit of hops. Flavor is hoppy, but not too bitter, with a very nice sparky note at the end. Palatte is bubbly but not overcarbonated.

Draught at Buntavar, Svit. Malty, herbal and peachy notes combined with hints of grapefruit. The hoppiness is fresh, green and crisp, as if taken straight from the bag before cooking. The malty base is rather light yet pleasantly present. Medium strong bitterness, there is something pilsner-like in this ale. I feel this one is a near perfect example of a light beer that is full of taste and boasts an elegant simplicity. Oh, and dat palate... Velvety smoothness, creamy, yes the creaminess is profound. Marvellous!
Bottle 33 cl from Barleywine, CPH. Very hazy orange with a white head. Citrus, lemon, orange marmelade, quite bitter, some malt. Medium body, medium carbonation, bitter finish.

Citrusy aroma, mainly orange and some lemon with hints of stable. Very hazy, orange colour. Pretty bitter, very bitter for being so thin, although not to bitter. Light body, thin texture medium carbonation, not as creamy as expected. Nice light and refreshing with the thin body and bitterness, good summer beer.
Bottle, 330 ml from Za Popent, Ljubljana. Pours cloudy orange with small white head. Light hoppy fruity. Light to medium bodied. Expected a bit more.
Bottle. Style #75. Pours hazy golden color, white head. Aroma is hoppy, grapefruit. Taste is medium bitter, medium sweet, grapefruit, peach. Medium dry finish.

Light opalescent, sun yellow in colour with a medium sozed but fading white head. Noses of grapefruit and lightly of orange peel with biscuit, bready aromas. The texture offers a rather tangy first hit fading into a pleasant refreshing carbonation. The body is rather light and the finish is well balanced in its noticeable hop and malt harmony, lasting for a moment.

Bona cervesa, es bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

Head: fluffy, white. Colour: hazy golden orange. Aroma:citric hops, some malt. Taste: citrus, bitter-sweet body. Palate: oily, bitter-sweet finish, some CO2. Overall: nice.

Pours a cloudy golden. Aroma is on the malty side but there are some hops as well. Taste is spicy with citrus hops at first, finish is smoother. there is also some yeast present, giving it a sour note.
330 ml. bottle. Thanks Kai. Pours a cloudy pale gold with a very nice fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, malt, and yeast. Taste is lemon, orange, malt, and yeast. Very nice.
prima birra che provo della Mikkeller. Quel cream mi aveva indotto a pensare di trovarmi di fronte ad una birra dolce, tuttaltro :D nonostante ciò lho trovata discreta.

Pours yellow to orange with a big white head. Aroma of corn and malts. Pretty sweet floral hoppy notes as well. Taste is quite smooth and quite grainy at the same time. Hops and corn gives both a fairly sweet, light and fresh side to it. Great beer for food i assume. Nice and easy drinking.

Bottle @ Elfos Pub, Perugia, Italy. Pours with a golden clear colour, off-white frothy head. Aroma is medium malty, medium hoppy with notes of herbs and resin, additional notes of cheese. Softly sweet, medium bitter, softly sour. Medium body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.
Flaska @ Fridas. Balans är ordet, både i arom smak och kropp. Väldigt lättdrucken.
330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange colour with a medium cream coloured head. Aroma has notes of citrus fruit, malt and hops. Smooth malty flavor with grapefruit and a dry, bitter, hoppy finish.
Golden with medium head. Bitter dry yeast pilsener/ triple taste with grainy and dry aftertaste.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a hazy yellowish amber colour with a thin veneer of bright white foam. Aroma is sweet apples, bread, citrus, herbs and some caramel stuff as well. Taste is moderately bitter with a nice roundness, also lots of sweetness, but always with a fresh bitterness to balance it off.
Listed as 4.9%. Poured hazy light amber with a frothy off white head. Aroma of sweet citrus and bitter hops, light lactose. Light to medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.
Hazy pale yellow with a fairly large thin head. Vague red fruit aromas. Taste is slightly sweet with light bitterness.
Hazy golden color, white head. Pineapple and grapefruit nose, yeast, hint of toffee. Grapefruit and resin taste, hints of malt and alcohol. Dry finish. Medium carbonation, medium to light body.

Fľaa. Farba zlatá, nie vak pekná číra. Pena pekná biela. Aróma sladová, jemne citrusová a s ľahkými tónmi teplého sladeného mlieka. V chuti jemne sladko - horká. Telo zvlátne, nie celkom vyváené, ale pivo pitelné.
From 0,33l bottle. Pours straw yellow liquid, very hazy. Aroma: citrus, resin, very intensive. Taste: light sweet, medium bitter, heavy sour. saaz hops. Palate: light body, lively carbonation.
On tap at Grand Öl & Mat. Id like to regard this more as a American Pale Ale for beginners than a real cream ale. In that sense its decent.

Bottle (330 ml) @ À la Bière comme à la Bière (Paris). Slightly hazy golden with a sparse white head and little lacing. Aroma is of citrus, herbal hops and malt. Taste is very similar with citrus, light herbal bitterness and a decent malt backbone. Light body. Moderate carbonation. Slightly dry finish. Im not sure how this is a Cream Ale, but its a tasty beer nonetheles. Refreshing and drinkable.
White foamy head that faints quickly. Suddle hoopy taste. Aroma of yeasts and citrus. Dry palate. Overall: 15

Petite bouteille agrémentée de Thompson et du logo de Revelation Cat. Cette bouteille meilleure avant le 21/05/2015 fut partagée avec Patrick. Bière jaune avec une mousse blanche très crémeuse. Au nez le liquide sent le malt pils avec du grain, des houblons herbeux et du citron. En bouche il se développe à la manière dune Pilsner. Il y a du grain, des houblons herbeux et citronnés. La finale est passablement amère. La bouche est la simple continuité du nez. Agréable une cream ale qui ressemble à une cream lager 6/10.

La petite bouteille (meilleure avant le 21/05/15) de Mikkeller que je viens douvrir porte létendard de la brasserie italienne Revelation Cat.  Anyway, ce nest pas un détail qui est important.  Ceci dit, il est quelque fois bon de faire du name droping.  Ça fait un peu Houellebecq.  Bon, revenons à cette bière plutôt dorée qui fabrique une mousse presque durable.  Au nez, le côté malté rappelle le pain, les céréales pils et la lager fortifiée.  Les houblons américains apportent une dimension légèrement fruitée.  Disons que les cultivars ne sont aucunement explosifs.  Sur les papilles, les saveurs développées par les malts pils me font penser à un type de bière allemande.  Le trio houblonné tente par tous les moyens de grimper dans léchelle de cette lager déguisé en cream ale.  En bouche, le liquide présente un corps de bonne densité avec un pétillement un peu relâché.  La texture me semble être avant tout crémeuse.  La finale laisse plutôt une impression qui me fait subitement penser à la bière qui nous arrive quelque fois de la Franconie.

Pours out a bright golden yellow with a finger of white head that leaves a few lacing rings. The nose is well hopped surprisingly with a nice grapefruit and some light caramel notes. The middle has sweet light malts and some caramel and creamy smooth notes. The finish has a mild but prominent hop. Overall, a smooth, hopped up session ale.

Draught at 4:20. Nice citrus hop nose, light tropical fruits, somewhat spicy. Flavor is sweet lemon, grain or corn, very dry and bitter over all. Nice and easy drinking, but a remarkable dryness. Good.

AROMA: big citrussy hops typical of a Mikkeller beer
APPEARANCE: cloudy golden yellow with a bick rock white head that laces perfectly
TASTE:crisp hops on a nice grainy  malt with a pilsnerish character. This would be one hell of a session beer
PALATE: light to medium bodied with a great carbonation and a crisp hop finish
OVERALL: an extremely delicious lager with  much more character than any cream ale (Sleemans, Kilkennys) than I have ever experienced. This would make a great summer evening beer

Little cloudy light yellow with a big white cap. The aroma is delicate hoppy and fruity, peaches, apricots, melon, with a citrus note i would say. The body is medium/light very balanced and a delicate malt aroma with a consistent carbonation that makes it very refreshing and soft on the roof of the mouth. More bitter and dry than creamy finish. I truly found this more of a pale ale than cream ale...but what the fuck do I know about cream ales.
Bottle wi Ben. Cloudy yellow with a white head. Very lagerish but with a pronounced hoppiness. Nice to have finally tried a Cream Ale. Thanks Ben
From bottle. Cloudy yellow with white head. Spicy hop aroma with yeast. Spicy hop taste, some citrus, dry finish. Decent enough
My first cream ale nothing to write home about. A little cardboard flavor that doesnt last long on the tongue, which is a good thing

[Bottle from the Bottle Shop, Canterbury] My first cream ale. Hazy gold with a moderate white head and too much fizz - the fizz hides the fact that theres a nice smooth beer behind..  Nice fresh hop aroma, but actual flavours are muted - a hint of ginger here, some cardboard there, and a couple of drops of lemon.  Generally on the sweet side, but a mild dry grassy bitterness emerges at the end.  Its decidedly average.  If this is the best cream ale, I dont think I want to try any of the lesser ones.
Bottle.  Courtesy of Jesse.  Thanks.  Clear yellow with a fizzy whit head.  Very nice floral, vanilla, orange cream, and grain aroma and taste with a bright lively palate.  Very good.
Bottle. Cloudy pale yellow, medium head. Flowery aroma of American hops. Dry hoppy taste with some apricot. Quite tasty.
cloudy light amber colour, small head. Very doughy with a hop bite, dont know why they call it cream ale, more like a pale ale, very very good though
Molt de nas de lichi. Molt floral, aromàticament mareja. Poc cos, refrescant i fàcil de beure.

The great hop profile on the nose of this beer overpowers the attempted creaminess, and the creaminess takes away the crisp bitterness of the hops, leaving behind a rather tasty apa style beer. Unfortunately I dont taste a genuine cream ale or a genuine apa. Nice beer but I wouldve preferred they put this hop nose on a genuine apa.
Bottle from Superbest, Rødovre. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, spice and malt.
Uuurhh, this is tasty. Very subtle but almost like an IPA. Flowery, almost lemon. Great cooperation between these danes and italians. Bottle at t klooster in Delft

Draft.  Pours gold with frothy white head; great lacing.  Aroma is sweet malt, banana, and light hops.  Flavor is initial citrus hops balancing out to a smooth creamy taste with a little spice towards the end.  Medium body with light carbonation and warmth.  Good cream ale and I enjoyed the added hop taste upfront.

Tap.  Pours lightly hazy gold with a medium, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is earthy, citrus and herbal hops, straw and biscuit malt with light fruity esters.  Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness, medium malt and fruity esters with a dry finish.  Light body and warmth with medium carbonation.

33 cL from Beers of Europe into an Affligem glass.  Slightly opaque orange beer with ok head, and a bit fizzy.  Well hopped, dry and bitter.  Nice fruity hop aroma, bit like apricot.  Just a little too dry, a good beer none-the-less.
En botella, color dorado claro poca espuma,aromas sutiles a fruta tropical y citricos.ligera, sabrosa y lupulada.fantastica!

From a 330ml bottle on 30/12/2011. Has a nice light floral, fruity aroma (passionfruit and lychee). The flavour is also fruity with some caramel in the mix. The most notable feature is a quite powerful lemon and grapefruit hop finish which lingers in the mouth for ages after you swallow. A very refreshing. drop.

Bottle.  Cloudy golden/yellowy beer with a strongish head.  The aroma is lemony and hopped, and the flavour is well hopped with a smooth long dry and bitter finish.  Overall a very nice zesty and hoppy beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beers of Europe and Im pretty sure on keg at BrewDog bar before this. Pours a golden colour with a thin white head. Aroma is really fruity with lots of pineapple, some passion fruit and caramel also. Similar flavours and quite bitter with moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Warming alcohol linger and a little rice. Tasty.

330ml bottle pours a pale golden color with a modest white head that settles down to some spots of lacing.  Aroma is citrusy hops.  Taste is citrusy hops and light caramel sweetness with a hint of fruits.  A nice cream ale, probably one of the best cream ales I have sampled to date.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, during 3Floyds Night 2011. Finally my first cream ale! Hazy golden color with a small white head that disappears. Malty aroma with a citric hops.. Citric fruity taste, mildly malty. Dry bitter finsih. Thin body. Smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours golden. The aroma has got notes of "perfumed cream" and cellar. Strange. Quite crisp taste, but at the same time very creamy. Quite hoppy aswell. Smooth. Not a bad beer, maybe cream ales are just not for me.

Bottle from Beer Planet.
Pours golden with a white head.
Malty aroma with some hops and stale air.
Sort of fatty mouthfeel, malty like a cross between a lager and ale. Black currant and a bit bitter.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours opaque straw yellow witha two finger fluffy white head. Head dies down quite quickly. Some moderate lacing sticks around. Nose is citrus, slight zest and light passionfruit/tangerine. Seems to be a lime note playing around behind it all. Taste is slight citrus with a touch of pine and tangerine/passionfruit - very mild punchbowl fruit notes. Orange and lemon mix well. Very balanced. Soft to moderate carbonation with a medium mouth feel. Nothing too special but as far as cream ales go it is very well done as you would expect from Mikkeller

on tap, pours hazy yellow with a small white head, Aroma: citrussy hops, lemon, peach, lemon peel, tangerine, slight grassy, fruity sweet, toasted, light mouthfeel, Taste is, tangerine, light pine, lemon, and citrussy hops, lemon peel, orange, light grassy bitterness, some malty sweetnes, a bit toasted, Very easy to drink. a slight bitternes in the aftertaste.

On tap at flying saucer. Pours a cloudy yellow gold with a small frothy off white head with sticky lacing. The aroma is a earthy hop and grain. Thin mouthfeel with a light hop and grain with cirsp citrus finish. A very good Cream from Mikkeller

Bottle.
Cloudy orange brown with a very porous dirt white head that lace.
Aroma is first sweet with cookie dough and a nice fruity and flowery hoppiness. Peach, candied orange, grapefruit. But the sweet and hoppy notes fold back a bit and turn more citrus peel with grass and wet stone.
Flavour is much drier than the aroma first implied with grapefruit and apricot, metal and a piney bitterness.
Quite weak body with watery notes and a soft tickling carbonation.
As my bottle was 1,5 years old it was way overdue I guess. Still, its too watery.
Has a light fresh hop aroma with some light orange and citrus notes. A celan and refreshing easy drinking style.

Bottle from Beer planet web shop. Hazy golden color with medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, floral hops, yeast and some spices. Taste, grapefruit, yeast, lemon peel, some malt, pines, spices. Nice long spicy bitter finish. Nice.

Bottle 33cl. Murky golden beer with white head, good lasting and lacing. Aroma is fruity: citrus, pineapple; malty and yeasty aromas are also present. Bitter flavour, persistent in the mouth, final bittery too. Average carbonation with medium body.

Beer No. 84 on my tour through Austria, Germany and Denmark. 
On tap at Mikkeller bar, Copenhagen. Yellow/golden coloured, creamy white head, grapefruity nose. Pleasant grapefruity hoppy taste with light peppery notes in the finish. Bitter one and also very good beer.
Bottle. Clear yellow colour with large creamy white mostly lasting head. Fruity aroma. Sweet fruity flavor. Creamy palate.
(Brasserie 4:20)Very big citrus aroma..resin,floreal herbs...medium body and carbonation,long dry finish..very good beer!
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured yellow with a white head.  aroma was plastic, citrus, and pine.  flavor was pine and citrus.  body was light with high carbonation.

Pours a golden, lemon-coloured yellow (clearer than expected) with a huge, clean white, frothy head. It has a soft carbonation (almost no bubbles visible from the glass, they can be felt while drinking). Aroma is orange peel, lemon peel, hops and other fruit (agrumes), with a hint of sweetness. Taste is citrus with a good amount of aromatic hops. It has body, but its also very light, I dont really know how to describe it, but I found it rather pleasant. Finish is fresh and hoppy on the palate, with agrumes still present. It was my first Mikkeller and Im really satisfied. Ill surely go fo another one, along with others of the same brewery.
From the bottle. Poured golden with a slight head. Mix of light hops and yeast with fruits and pine, followed by a bitter finish. Has fair carbonation.

Bottle @ Home. Pours golden with a huge white head. Aroma of sweet´fruity and cutrussly hops, orangepeel, grapefruit. Taste is light bready malt, fruity hops, peach,grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation. Light crisp easy drinking beer. 250911
On tap. Very good! Gold colour, white head, a little bit bitter and pleasant to drink.
Bottle. pours hazy golden with large fluffy white head. the aroma is fruity, hoppy, grape and lots of it.... The flavor is grape, peaches, hops and flowers........ sweet, light hoppy finish.....
Nose is quite heavy bitter hops, little rye, dry lemon, leaves, feel is watery, carb is mediumheavy, taste is bittersweet dry hops, fresh lemon, weak barn yard

On tap at Café Langebro, Copenhagen. Golden, slightly hazy colour with a frothy, white head. Fruity, powerfull aroma with citrus, grass and fresh hops. Bittersweet taste with notes of citrus, apricots and grassy hops with a dry and refreshing finish. Rather light body with a soft carbonation. Elegantly made beer with a fresh, hoppy bitterness. Recomended!

330ml bottle. Pours a clear, light gold, with a small, white and quickly dissipating head, and thus looks disturbingly like some sort of bland lager. Luckily, it is a better beer than its looks would suggest. Light floral and grassy hops mix with a touch of fresh white bread on the nose. Mild floral hops introduce the beer, followed by a hint of sweet apricot. A brief body of smooth caramel gives way to a mild hint of pine, and then an oddly metallic finish, which jars with an otherwise pleasant beer. Aside from the odd finish, this is a decent brew. Its a nice, restrained easy-drinker that doesnt try too hard. It is perhaps a little on the bland side, but not enough to spoil it.

Botella de 330 ml servida en copa de Vino.Saboreada en mar´11.
Brota amarillo pálido.Turbia.Corona blanca,túpida y persistente.Burbujas de tamaño medio.Aromas de pan y levaduras.Fresco y picante amargor.Sabor seco,pinoso y de agradable lupulización.Sensación muy refrescante y de fácil asimilación.Cuerpo lígero y carbonatación correcta.Sabores y aromas muy bien equilibrados.330ml bottle served into an Oversized glass.Enjoyed on mar´11
Pours pale yellow.Foggy.White persistent & dense crown.Medium size bubbles.Wheat & yeast aromas,citric notes.Crispy bitterness.Dry piney & gentle hoppy flavor.Very refreshing sensation & easy drinkability.Light body & correct carbonation.Very well balanced flavors & aromas.
330ml bottle. Light amber colour with a cloud of pure white foam. Clear in the glass with mild aromas of sweet corn and grain. Low bitterness with nothing jumping out. Clean and crisp in the mouth.

Pale orange hazy beer with thin white head. Aroma of grapefruit and orange pith. Citrus fruits and initial spike of bitterness followed by a rounded malt sweetness and pineapple ester finish with lingering bitterness.
Very nice bitterness in the background. Not at all overwhelming, pleasant to drink.

Bottle 33cl, a cloudy orange-amber beer with medium head. Nose is on grassy hops and yeast. Aroma is grainy with intense fresh hops on grass and citrus, low malt notes, nice but near to usual pale ale structure, just slightly more creamy. Hops bouquet is nice anyway, with super long bitterness on aftertaste.

On draught at "The Blue Monk" Buffalo, during the Mikkeller tap take over. Pours a quite hazy honey like colour. Nice white head, that clings to the walls and an island left in the middle. Clumpy lace all over, like little fluffy clouds. Smell is citrus, some peach maybe, almost what reminds me of like a "5 Alive" or something. Taste is quite smooth and soft, theres a bitter finish on the finish, subtle citrus as well.
Draught @ Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Originally rated on 16.6.2010. Sweet, quite well balanced cream ale.

draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Almost a hefe looking pour. creamy white head. Lighter aroma. Easy drinking, light bitterness, almost unmikkeller like in that fashion. Nice balanced, uncomplicated/complex flavor. nice summer beer

Bottle from Ølbutikken, Copenhagen, Denmark. Aroma has some roasted notes from the malts but I cant really detect any hoppy aroma. Pours a light golden/yellow with a thick white foam. Taste is crisp and a little bitter, very pleasant. Mouthfeel is a bit thin but very refreshing.

On tap at Blue Monk in Buffalo, NY.  For the style, it was pretty good; as someone else noted, though, it was pretty hoppy for a cream ale.  Poured essentially a golden yellow and went down very smooth.  Easy to drink.
Birra bella fresca per lestate, gasata il giusto, luppolata senza eccessi, gradevolissima. Me ne faccio sempre una boccia da 1,5 litri al 4:20!
Bottle at Olympen, Oslo. Interesting hoppy creaminess, but nothing spectacular.

Smell: Grapefruit peel, light spicy notes, berries, floral.
Taste: Candy, grapefruit peel, vanilla.
Mouthfeel: Smoth, refreshing, light to medium body.
Notes: Nice session ale.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2015 33 cl bottle from Passione Birra. Cloudy golden yellow with an off.white head. Grassy and floral aroma. Medium carbonation, slightly creamy texture, moderate bitterness. Easy to drink, very nice.

Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark. Hazy deep goolden, medium off-white head. Fruity hop aroma, with peaches, citrus, and some pine needles. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with bitter finish.

Draft at Frisco Taphouse, Columbia, MD on 06/12/11.  Served in a goblet/Trappist glass.  A clear pale gold colored body with a smallish off-white head.  A subtly sweet aroma of cream, vanilla, caramel, a touch of corn, and hints of grass & citrus.  Went down fairly thin and relatively creamy.  Carbonation was a tad low.  Somewhat refreshing.  Semi-sweet upfront taste-wise.  Creamy middle with some vanilla.  Musty.  Kinda crisp at the end with a touch of wheat and some citrus.  Solid attempt at a lame style.
Little bit cloudier but almost the same color as a lager (in Dutch:pils) Lovely strong hoppy smell and bitter taste.
buona birra con note agrumate e qul pizzico di amaro. Da provare!!!
Clear golden fizzy body with a creamy long lasting white head. Nice hoppy aroma with a lot of caramel and strawberry as well. Full palate. Hoppy and sweet flavour, fruits, dry finish.

Draft at Farmers Cabinet with Pat, Dallas and Jesse. Pours a light golden body with slight haze and white lacing. Aroma is light bitter hops. Mouthfeel is smooth with notes of citrus hops, vanilla, and pils.

Bottle. Not really sure what to expect here. Pours a quite hazy dirty golden amber colour. Very small white coloured head. A little lacing. Big citrus hop aromas in the nose with some minerally yeast character showing through. A little malt sweetness hanging around somewhere in the back. Flavours are dominated by hop bitterness. Some malt sweetness there but the whole thing is slightly out of balance.
