Bottled 330ml (Beer Planet, BB 05/2012, bottled 05/2010)
Hazy orange color, steady small white head. Strange metallic aroma with hayish hops and wild strawberries. Light to medium-bodied. Nice crisp hoppyness with evident American hop profile. Light sweetish notes. Refreshing, kind of fusion of ale and lager. Summer drink.
Draught at Brasseire 4:20. Hazy orange body, white head. Aroma has lots of hops, mainly lemon and grapefruit. Some yoghurt, too. little yeasty, but it ok. Nice bitterness and really great cream ale.
On tap at The Trappist. Pours cloudy yellow with a thick off-white head and a banana aroma. There is a smooth pale malt flavor with banana ester and a dry bitter finish. Refreshing.

On tap at Burger in Santa Cruz. Pours a light golden color with a firm white froth. Aroma is full of hay and grass with a faint fruit salad note. Flavor is pale malts and minerals with a big noble hop blast. Really nothing like a cream ale, reminds me more of a hop-forward american pilsner with an ambiguous ale-ishness. Slightly tart, maybe a touch of wheat. Great hop character, fresh and spicy. A little astringent and thin on the palate.
Draft at Churchkey.  Clear yellow, solid white lacing.  Aroma of straw.  Taste is floral with odd spice.
Draft. Pours blonde with a nice white head. Aroma is citrus, cereal. Flavor is soapy hops, biscuit, diacetyl, more resinous hops. Finish is bitter. Not sure if this is a cream ale but I like it.

Degustada en la cervecería Les 4 Pedres de Badalona. Fue mi primera Mikkeller/Revelation Cat y la verdad es que fue una grata sorpresa. Aroma seco, a lúpulo, flores, cítricos, malta. Poco carbónica, floral y amarga al final del trago. Una buena cerveza.

Tap at Paradiso Dupont. The pour is quite pretty: a glowing, light, hazed yellow with a small, denser, off-white head. Not much retention or lace but Paradiso is notorious for shitty looking pours. Baby lace emerges from fizzy retention. Aroma is sugary lemon, citrus hoppy, lemon/lime Gatorade powder, light orange candies. As it warms, a quick peek in the nose blasts you with raspberry schnapps. Taste is fizzy up front, then moves to English biscuit malty with mild diacetyl and soapy hops. Very soapy back end moving to massive bitterness verging on astringent chemical and heavy nut skins. Large carbonation presence detracts from mouthfeel. Large resinous hops creates a 100 IBU explosion that is just so far off from Cream Ale it is hilarious. Would put most American Pale Ales to shame. Definitely way off for style, a gimmick, and should be moved to the APA category. 6A. Cream Ale BJCP Style Guidelines
Aroma: Faint malt notes. A sweet, corn-like aroma and low
levels of DMS are commonly found. Hop aroma low to none.
Any variety of hops may be used, but neither hops nor malt
dominate. Faint esters may be present in some examples, but
are not required. No diacetyl.
Flavor: Low to medium-low hop bitterness. Low to moderate
maltiness and sweetness, varying with gravity and attenuation.
Usually well attenuated. Neither malt nor hops prevail in
the taste. A low to moderate corny flavor from corn adjuncts is
commonly found, as is some DMS. Finish can vary from
somewhat dry to faintly sweet from the corn, malt, and sugar.
Faint fruity esters are optional. No diacetyl.Classic American (i.e., pre-prohibition) Cream Ales were slightly stronger, hoppier (including some dry hopping) and more bitter (25-30+ IBUs). Bitterness
rarely rises above 20 IBUs.

26/04/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (tap). Dorata vivissima, limpida e brillante, con lieve schiuma biancastra. Al naso risulta ben equilibrata nelle sue componenti maltate e luppolate, ma un po assente. In bocca sprigiona tutte le sue potenzialità: attacco dolciastro, fruttato, appena caramellato, con finale amaro morbido e mai eccessivo. Corpo medio-basso, carbonazione corretta. Rinfrescante, beverina, una ottima birra da bere in quantità industriali.

Murky tannish brownbasically looks like Medimusle (what a horrid attempt at spelling) I havent used that comparison in a long while. Comes complete with a long lasting thick skiff floating on top. Lots of hops in the nose with the main focus on the Amarillo hops, for me that aint good Im not a fan of those. The malts remind of toasted white bread. The aroma seems so very hoppy, to hoppy for the style in my opinion. Taste is thin and has large amounts of bitter slightly citrusy hops. Malts are hidden and hard to find in the mess of hops but they do have a mild biscuit/toast flavor. Beer is ok I guess maybe a touch on thin side but ok its just not what I thought it should be nor was what I was in the mood for.
UPDATED: APR 18, 2011 delicata sia al naso che al gusto.con profumi floreali e un gusto agrumato e leggermente amarognolo.comunque molto gradevole e beverina.

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Hazy orange body, medium creamy white head. Nose is pine and hints of apricot and grass. Taste is pine, grass and hints of apricot and some kind of sour-ish maltiness that I dont care much for but do encounter in beers from time to time (hard to describe). Smooth, near-slick mouthfeel. OK, but not great. If this is among the best you can get in this rather obscure genre, I wont be hunting for other specimens any time soon. Not even with a Tommy gun, as the bottle indicates.

Tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours a near clear pale golden body with a small side sticking head. Aroma is really low with hints of citrus and orange. Otherwise quite anonymous nose on this. I was expecting a cream-like body texture but thats not at all what this was. Body is light and medium, and the carbonation is quite soft. Flavors is citrus dominated with notes of clementines and lemon-zest with quite low hopy bitterness. Nice and drinkable but dont let the name fool you; This is not something you can serve your cat - OR make ice cream of.

Bottle. A small, white head sits on top of this hazy, yellowish pale golden beer. Citrusy hops dominates the aroma, leaving little room for the malts. Medium body, with flavors of citrusy hops, pine cones and a pleasant bitterness. Some pale malts in the background. Bitter finish. A beer that drinks very easily, would be nice to have a few of these for the warmer days of spring and summer. 110107

On tap at CP&K. It pours hazy golden yellow with a thin foamy white head. The nose is hay, pine, bread, grapefruit and lactose. The taste is surprisingly bitter and consists of lactose, grass, pine, lemon, grapefruit, apricot, pineapple and bread, with a moderate length dry-bitter finish. A pleasant brew for sipping on a sunny afternoon.
Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is dry, hop, flower, citrus, malt. Flavour is dry, hop, flower, citrus, malt. Medium body. OK beer.

330ml brown bottle. Golden in colour, a little haze. Big rocky white head. Sticky clingy lace. Hoppy, sweet, orangey aroma. Flavour has some honey, floral notes, orange peel. Ends with grapefruit and orange hops, lasting bitter finish. Light in body, light carbonation. Very easy to drink, surprisingly hoppy for a cream ale, nice and refreshing.

27 March 2011, keg. light orange and fairly hazy, no bubbles, slight lacing. smells like there is much more alcohol than just 5%. creamy, sweet malt aroma w/ some dry hop background. thin/med body and fairly fizzy. only hops in the taste. thin, watery leafy hops. okay. not the greatest Mikkeller and not really what i would call a cream ale.

Bottle at home. Love the label! Pours hazy/cloudy orange/amber, very pretty color on this, despite the clarity issues. The head is fantastically persistent, starts out 3-fingers thick, rocky, and snow white, and persists for more than 40 minutes! You WILL still have head by the time youve finished this beer! Lacing is quite sticky and persistent as well. I gotta give this one a 5 for appearance. Nose is citrus hops; light grapefruit and tangerine, nice malt notes coming through as well, lovely clean grain, and just a hint of mildly sulphury yeast. Flavours of fresh citrus hops; mandarin oranges, navel orange rind, grapefruit, persimmon, maybe just a touch of pineapple, very little bitterness, some nice earthiness here as well, lovely malt profile behind. Flavours go from IPA-lite to something resembling the finish of a quality Pils, all earth and malt. Here I thought I hated Cream Ale, but I guess not...
Ljus, med en liten majsdoft jämte humlen. Lätt, lite syrlig, gräsig humle. Kort eftersmak. Ganske platt och tråkig.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy golden coloured with a nice egg white lacing head. Aromas of floral hops, peach and grass. Fruity flavour with notes of lemon and spruce. Nice dry and bitter finish.

Guest keg at BrewDog Edinburgh. Pours a bright, hazy amber with a thick white foam. Aroma is hard to find, light vanilla, something slightly creamy maybe but also some hoppy fruit. Bit weird. Taste is definitely rich, and fizzy, with some sort of light pepper and grass notes. Hard to work out, as I have a cold and am not familiar with cream ales. Aftertase is clean and bitter. Drinkable, not amazing.

Bottle at Lompa. Hazy yellow/golden color, medium white head. Malty aroma with a touch of hops, orange peel. Bitter taste with caramel and herbs. I think this is my first cream ale so I cant tell if its a good cream ale or not, but the beer is absolutely drinkable.

Label is great I love the tommy gun shooting hops. It is very pale with almost no head. Aroma is bold hopy. It smells like cotton candy. And grapefruit. The flavour does not agree with me it tastes like grapefruit rind. and that is about it it is bitter and unappealing. The mouth feel is rather full. but this is not a beer that I care for. Not my bag.

Lots of hops!!! As per the Mikkeller formula. Spikey aroma of hops but it isnt bitter at the end of the nose somehow... Pale golden in colour, a bit hazy, some head on pour that inextrica ly keeps on lasting, even thouh most beers wih so little head usually fade out of fizz in a min or two. The hops do dominate the flavour, but thet arnt bitter. I cant explain that, and for a home brewerits very vexing. It is quite creamy, the hops flavour lasts and lasts. Mikkeller, you ve done it again & I cant explain how.

This is a bit of a strange tasting refreshing brew. Slightly hazy gold with a large foamy off white cap. The aroma is grassy and fresh lemons upfront. Groovin to Blue Rondo A La Turk by Dave Brubeck. There is a background pungent hint, some of that canadian lager aroma in the malts and a bit of floral scents. Very nice! Soft and soothing. The taste is similar with the hops sticking out more prominently. The hops have citrus but it seems to come into play later on in the sip. Grainy and fresh with a lemony finish and a very refreshing bitterness. Some grass and a bit of a floral taste tied. This is turning out to be the perfect beer for my music right now. Plenty o carbonation, a messy glass and tasty hops make this a yummer.

light hoppy nose with gras hay and lemon - nice but light!
cloudy with a fine head.
dry, fullbodied, fine length, some light lemon in aftertaste. soft for a Mikkel beer. nice and extremely easy drunk - would like a barrel for a gardenparty!

Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is malty and quite hoppy - grapefruit and lemon. Flavor is rather sweet and rather bitter. Finish is bitter and dry. As usual Mikkeller adds a shitload of hops making it a very good beer, but I dont know what it has to do with a cream ale. I havent tried a lot of cream ales, so Im not quite sure what the style stands for, but this beers certainly does not match the style describtion on this site. 071110

Pours an almost cloudy straw color. Not sure if it was chill haze or what, but it wasnt as brilliant as I thought it would be. Ample white head that sticks around for a bit then drops to a small head that leaves a little lacing.
Hops in the nose and thats about it. But it smells pretty good. A bit much for cream ale though.
Hops with a bit of a muted watered down IPA taste. Barely any maltiness, but it is a cream ale - it just doesnt taste like a cream ale either.
Thin watery fizzy feeling left behind with a bitterness and hop flavor. Not very cream ale-ish.
Its alright if you want a watered down IPA type of beer. But if you are wanting a cream ale - like this claims to be - youd be better off with a Genny. I like Mikkeller beers, but this one falls short of his normal offerings.

330ml on tap at Ølkjellermandag, Håndverkerstuene where the beer was served in a tulip-shaped glass and at a fine drinking temperature. Hazy golden body. Creamy, white head when agitated. Nice lacing. Fruity aroma with an herbal, hoppy touch. Fresh and dry citric fruits in flavour. Smooth, dry bitter end. Oily palate. Refreshing (Oslo, 07.02.2011).

Light golden coloured beer with a medium head that holds pretty good. Citrus, hoppy smell, spiced, decent. Taste is very hoppy, light spiced, citrus fruits. Hard to detect cream, decent but expected more. Dry hoppy aftertaste.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2011 Bevuta alla spina alla Brasserie 4:20 (Roma) - Dorata chiara, limpida, con schiuma ruvida abbastanza persistente. Aroma fresco, pungente, fruttato e luppolato. In bocca fruttata, moderatamente amara, equilibrata ed elegante. Al palato risulta forse un po troppo ruvida e frizzante, sarebbe interessante provarla a pompa.

On tap at Håndverkerstuene, Oslo.
Soft and inviting, yet a bitter edge underneath giving far more character than I associate with this style. Hazy gold, thin head. Some mint, herbal dry finish.

On tap. Hazy light golden colour. Small to no head. Aroma is hoppy with notes og citrus and tropical fruits. Flavour is fresh and bitter. Lots of hops and bitterness. Tropical fruits again. Some creaminess perhaps, but this is more reminiscent of an IPA. Medium long aftertaste.

Quite interesting. Amber hazy ale, average white head. Grapefruit aroma, intense hoppy as usual. Some mature "yellow" fruits aroma (peaches) is also present. Strong bitterness with a light round sweetness. Light to medium body.
Not so "cream ale", very "Mikkeller".

Bottle. Murky light-orange with an enticing creamy off-white head. Bold aromas of orange, vanilla and pine. Flavour dominated by a piney bitterness, pineapple and pink grapefruit. Very, very enjoyable.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2011 Citrus grass aroma with a pale yellow hazy appearance.  Light sour-bitter hoppy finish. Fresh southen-europe style under the burning dessert sun. In north Europa the taste longs for the coming spring and summer. Pleasant but prefer more dryhopping. May have been stronger brewed 16/11/09!
Pours slightly cloudy yellow with medium off-white head. Hoppy and citrussy aroma. Flavour is hopped grass with a malty aftertaste. Ultimately this is slightly overhopped for me.

Thanks to yespr for this one! The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Very zippy, huge head. Starts quite dry, woody-hoppy, a bit grasy-sourish. Finish milder, not as dry as the beginning. Well balanced and grasy-spicy finish. Nice!

Tasted 2011-02-01. Pours hazy, pale yellow with white head. Aroma: Fresh hops. Taste: Very fresh - and only moderately bitter - hops. Very tasty, mild (Mikkeller wise) beer. I think it would make a good intro to hoppy beers.

Flaske 33 cl. Ugennemsigtig gylden hælde med et mælke hvidt skær, med et lille hvidt hoved. Aroma af malt og citrus. Smag af malt, humle og grapefrugt. En frisk og lidt sammensnerpende mundfornemmelse, med let bitter grapefrugt smag i afslutningen.

330ml bottle. Clouded apricot almost like a witbier, low and uneven white head lacing considerably. Aroma of lime juice, blackcurrant and perfumed exotic fruits; good crisp flavour with a sparkle of fizz, a perfumed, soapy bitterness suggesting crystallised lemon peel, some peanut husk and a squirt of neat mango cordial. Not sure what the hell a cream ale is, or if Ive just drank one but this is a beautiful, zesty beer I could see off in some quantity.
Colpisce la freschezza del Luppolo e la complessità che si manifesta al palato. Il finale è un pò deludente, ma rimane un ottima ale.

330 ml bottle. Slightly dim yellow body with a big creamy white head. Nice citric aroma with malt. Flavor feels light malty, fresh and fruity with a bitterness that comes stronger after a while. Ends up quite smooth and bitter. Nice without being extraordinary.

Wow! This one is really good. I was expecting more creamy character but it is advanced and complex in its own right. At first, poured a hazy tan,gold orange color. Smells like fresh fruit and candy, orange, grapefruit, sugar, citrusy, the aroma hops jump. The taste is lightly creamy, citrusy, malty, ceraeal, dry with a zest. The fermentation is interesting, not a fully carbonated and not lambic. Its in between, but overall a great beer. The smell is amazing, the hops swim around on your tongue and when you swallow then citrus follows up and hangs out a little. Definitely get a creamy but dry refreshing idea with it. Fantastic, unique and def. worth a try

Draught @ Patricks Pub og Restaurant, Kristiansand
Pours hazy dark golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of caramel and fruity hops. Taste is light sweet and bitter with a dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin, carbonation is soft. I would say this is more like a hoppy american pale ale than a cream ale.
El auténtico yogur de IPA? xD En nariz es láctica y lúpulo fresco a la par. luego en boca es más herbácea terminando en la bacteria del queso.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with thick white head. Nose and taste of creamy light caramel malts, butter and hops. Medium body. Buttered toast finish.
Bottle.Pours pale yellow with a white head.Aroma peachy, herbal, and spicy.Flavor is bitter, sweet and fruity.Long bitter finish, medium body,average carbonation.Nice bitter beer.

(330ml bottle best by 5-20-13 thanks to bu11zeye) clear medium gold with few sparse fine off-white bubbles. Nose of honey, candied fruit, cotton candy, frosted mini wheats. Taste of rhubarb, rye, orange peel. Creamy carbonation, prickly even, oily slick medium thick body with a linger of rye.

Bottle @ home. Aroma is hoppy and fruity, touch of spice.
Flavour is quite bitter, very dry, lots of fruit.
Nice brew, but where is the cream?

On tap, 500ml at 4:20, Rome. Hazed gold with white head. Right from the start this is a bit of a hop monster, bitter and dry, there are grapefruit and lemon notes biting on the tongue, good intensity and mouthfeel, I didnt get the cream ale bit, but a very decent beer indeed.

Bottle @ EODT10

Pours a beautiful opaque orange body with a small fluffy head. Aroma is underwhelming, bit of soap, lager-like, some spices. Taste is better. Sweet at the start, dry bitter finish. Nice hop bitterness. Seems excellent for summer.

Bottle @ EODT10:
Small white foamy head on top of a hazy light orange to yellowish colored beer.
Smell hops, flowers, soap, candy sweet, fruit, apricot.
Taste is very nice bitter with a soft touch. A good mix of hops, fruit, grass, flowers, bitter, light sweet and light spicy.
Mid carbo, tingling mouthfeel and mid body.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle from ABC beers in the Hague.  Clear pour with no head, fresh, hoppy with a little fruit
bottle thanks to bu11zeye.  poured gold with a white head.  nose is creamy hops, fresh citrus, and pine.  smooth on the palate, flavor is creamy hops, with a hint of pine, and fruit.

Bottled. Pours Hazy, yellow with an average white, foamy head leaving some good lacings.Hoppy nose with citrus and grass. Average carbonation. Medium sweet flavour with citrus, fruits and caramel notes. Light to medium bodied. Light creamy texture. More dry and nice bitter finish. Crisp and OK.
bottle, thanks to bu11zeye, cloudy yellow color with creamy pineapple aroma, flavor is oaky tropical fruit
Bottle courtesy bu11zeye. Clear yellowish color with a bubbly head. Aroma is dry and spiced with some fruit snack aroma. Taste is also fruit roll-up with a bit of hops and grain. Sweet finish.
Bottle from bu11zeye.  Yellow pour with a small white head.  Aroma is soft and fruity, but great.  Taste is light fruit, a little bitter, and a great dry finish.

(330ml bottle, BB 20/05/13)  Pours a lightly hazy yellow body with a small off-white head.  Aroma of citrus, caramel, grass, floral, biscuits, and perfume.  Flavor of caramel, light lacto, citrus, florals, grass, and Fruity Pebbles cereal.  Probably the most complex variation of a cream ale that I have sampled.
This beer pours a dull yellow with a thin white head.  The aromas are pine, lemon zest and old closet.  The mouthfeel is watery and slightly bitter.  Cheers!

On tap at the Cask, Pub and Kitchen Mikkeller day, 27th Nov. Cloudy orange pour with a white head. Aromas of citrus, light malts, pineapple (dominates) and wheat. Crisp hop flavours with a dash of ginger thrown in. A very good beer to start the afternoon (or evening) off. Sharpens the palate somewhat.

Cask, Pub and Kitchen in Pimlico.

Citirc hops, some amount of grains and perfume on aroma. 

Taste is sweet honey, custard creams, some nice bitterness, a little sharp on the tongue, very juicy,, succulant fruits and marzepan. Very interesting. Very easy to drink and good to knock back.
UPDATED: FEB 5, 2012 Draught. Hazy amber with a very nice looking creamy head leaving some lacing. Quite bitter, with tropical fruits, hops and some spices.

Big offwhite head. Hazy light amber body with lots of carbonation. Resiny tropical fruit aroma with mealy notes. Sharply dry lemon and grapefruit taste with lime and flour notes. Light body. Sharpish mouthfeel. Dry citric wooden aftertaste with spicy lacquer notes. Quite nice, but very one-sided and definitely no cream in sight. Reveals more complexity as it warms. (0.33l bottle, Olympen, Oslo.)

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2012 First ratingDraught at Haket, Göteborg, on November 11, 2010Orange color, smallish off-white head. Bitter, mango, hoppy taste. Weak hoppy scent. Medium and moussy mouthfeel. Bitter aftertaste, dry. Medium high bitterness.I would like it a bit sweeter.7/3/7/3/13=3.3RerateDraught at The Rover, Göteborg, on July 6, 2012Hazy honey color, white head. Hoppy, grape, citrus, fruity, alcohol scent. Malty, hoppy, bitter taste. Bitter and fruit peels aftertaste. Medium mouthfeel, high dry bitterness.6/3/6/3/12=3.0

A clear golden colored beer, with a thick foamy white head. The aroma of fruits with hop bitter. The taste is fruity as well, citrus, sparkling with bitter hops. The aftertaste is pleasant bitter with notes of sweet.

330 ml bottle. From København, Denmark.
Cloudy deep golden colour with small white head.
Aroma is fruits, peach, some sugar, malt and yeast.
Flavour is sharp bitter hoppiness, balancing malt and sweet fruits. 
Bitter aftertaste is rather short.

bottle from Platinum Liquor, nth strathfield. pours a hazy yellow/cream, with a medium white head. aromas of peach, apricot and grapefruit. nice flavours of vanilla, pine, apricot and grapefruit. slight bitterness and a creamy mouthfeel. quite nice!
Tap. Nice balanced hop aroma. Hazy golden color with a white head. Nice body with a very light almost coffee note. Dry bitter and hop palate. Nice

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2010 [9/27/10] Bottle at a friends place in Amsterdam. Slightly hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma of grapefruits, a bit of pomelos, pineapple and apricot notes. Bitter hoppy flavor with some citrus, pine needles notes and some sweet bready malt. Light to medium-bodied.

On tap. Unclear yellow-orange with a bleached white head. Grassy hops on the nose and a distinct grass and hay hop flavor over a mild malt back. Small body and just a tad too much bitterness for a beer of this size.
Tasted at the Borefts bierfestival 2010 @ De Molen. I remember this as very peculiar aromawise. Lots of hazelnuts, toffee, chessnut & sweet coffee. A starbucks experience. Not sessionable however.

Draft at 33.  Pours a hazy yellow-gold with a big bone white head.  Aroma of pale malts, straw, floral hops, sugar, cereal, and corn.  Flavor of sweet pale malts, floral hops, cereal, cream, corn, straw, and pepper.  Medium-bodied, with high carbonation and a grainy mouthfeel.  The corn and cream notes (creamed corn?) arent overwhelming.  This certainly has more to it than most other cream ales Ive had, with some body and real punch to the flavor.  While it still isnt my favorite style, this is probably the best Ive had.

33 cl bottle, pours golden with a nice big white head, lots of carbonation, aroma of citrus, grass and floral hops with a hint of yeast, taste is grassy and citrusy with a bit of malt, decent bitterness, very light drinkable and pretty enjoyable, the kind of beer one can drink pretty much anywhere and anytime.
Aroma of citrus, lemon and tropical  fruits with herbs. Clean taste, persistent, good beer.

Pours hazy orange with a dense white head that gives nice lacing.  the aroma has sweet pale malt, floralness, spicy hops and light candy sweetness.  Medium smooth body with flowing sharp carbonation.  The taste starts sharper and drier than most cream ales and haps pale malt, spicy hops, light cream, crackers and peppery phenols.  The finish is very spicy and clean with a nice bite.  I dont notice any off flavors like corn or veggies that generally come with cream ales ~ nice change of pace here.  Gets earthy and resiny as it warms up.  Nice cream ale.

(Tap @ Olutravintola Konttori, Tampere. Rated @ 22.5.2010.)
Pours a hazy golden colour with a creamy white head. Very fresh on the nose with hints of hops and citrus. Peaches, citrus and grapefruit on the taste in addition to nice hoppiness. Notes of pine and grass too. Nice bitter finish. Very refreshing.

Very good, if dwindling, fine-bubbled, just off-white head over clear, darker-golden beer. Fruity, grapey hopnose; citrus, mandarine, muscatgrapes and lytchee - one exotic fruitcocktail to smell - wow. Warming up, it acquires a bit oversweet smell. Drier hop flavours, dried hops, immortelles, faint citrus and a bit of dough. All very discreet, but nice. Pretty carbonated feel, rather than creamy, and quite light to watery. Light beer, refreshing and easy drinkable. Sometimes a hundred times better than forced, sought-for concoctions.

Quite a lovely light beer. It smells a bit like mountain flowers, very fresh. The color is light yellow but creamy not transparent. Almost ochre. It has a fresh slightly sweet taste with a mild bitter after taste. Maybe a bit fruity even.

Draft @ Bishops Arms, Malmö. Pours a hazy pale golden color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity fresh hoppy citrus aroma. Sweetish malty creamy hoppy flavor with hints of citrus. Has a sweetish malty creamy hoppy finish.

02-AUG-2010, draft @Mikkeller.
What is really a cream ale?
This I would have taken for a pale ale any time.
Pale ale like in color, aroma and taste.
Light slightly hazy golden with white head.
Bitter citric and fruity.
Quite refreshing.
330ml bottle at the Bishops Arms, Stockholm, 13th Feb 2010. Hazy blonde with a large white head. Light hoppy aroma. Creamy palate and citrus flavours to the fore.

Bottle. Just hazy orange with a creamy white head. Hoppy aroma of orange zest, spices and a little pine. Firm lightly toasted malt with some orange and toffee sweetness underneath citrus bitterness. Slightly astringent. Ive not had a cream ale before AFAIK and this comes across to me as a nice modern golden ale.

Hazy yellow-golden pour.  The nose is fresh and quite bright and fruity.  There is a lot of fresh pineapple and mango as well as a nice bright pale malt nose.  There is a little bit of yeasty ester production that I find fairly common in some Mikkeller beers.  I dont really get a whole lot of corn flavour but there is a bright fresh hoppy bitterness on the back of the palate.  Pine cones on the finish.  Pretty solid stuff.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2014 Pours a hazy orange/yellow with a white head. Aroma is Yeasty and bready with some gentle funky notes, hops is there and some fruity notes. Taste add some malty notes, yeasty, dusty hops, citrus and pine. pretty fresh and very drinkable.

Hazy gold yellow. Hoppy nose. Love bitter beers especially their single hop brews. This strangely has a lovely fruity & creamy character behind the beautiful blend of Amarillo, Columbus [aka Tomahawk] and Challenger hops. Fantastic beer.

Picked this up at Bierkoning, Amsterdam, Netherlands, and consumed outside camper  at Camping Memling Bruges, Belgium 24-06-10  This pours hazy gold with a thin white head. There is a light soft hoppy nose, some furry bitterness in mouth. The names suggest that is creamy and it sort of is with everything being softened and blunted. There is a citrussy flavour, hops do show but its altogether a touch safe.   A6 A4 T7 P3 Ov13  3.3
Nice white top, lightly unclear golden, Aroma of citrus and bitterness, flavour of citrus and hops.
Draught. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Taste is medium bitter. Palate is quite dry. Aromas have citrus, cereal

Bottle. Not really sure what to expect here. Pours a quite hazy dirty golden amber colour. Very small white coloured head. A little lacing. Big citrus hop aromas in the nose with some minerally yeast character showing through. A little malt sweetness hanging around somewhere in the back.  Flavours are dominated by hop bitterness. Some malt sweetness there but the whole thing is slightly out of balance. Not too bad.
Bottle. Aroma of fruit, hops and a bit of citrus. Slightly unclear yellow colour with huge white head. Mild fruity and hoppy flavour with a bitter grapefruitlike finish.

UPDATED: JUL 22, 2013 Tap at Rattle n Hum. Pours mostly clear, yellow-gold with a sturdy white head. Wild lacing all about. Possesses the characteristics of an IPA, basically. Moderate sweetness but quite bitter. Even a bit of pine in the finish. Medium in body with soft carbonation, the beer does have a creaminess to it. (3.8)Bottle somewhere in the world in the last year. Pours lightly hazy yellow with a fine, white cream head. Pale and lightly tangy white bread in the snout. Dusty malt flavor, light sweetness, faint hay. Light bodied with average carbonation. Modestly sweet to finish, light bitter hay and dirt, toasty doughy malts. OK. (3.4)

Tap. Pale yellow, slightly hazy beer with a longlasting white head; pretty hoppy, sweet citrusy and grapefruity aroma with a somewhat creamy, light malty backbone; flavor is also very hop bitter, slightly sweet fruity and piney - probably some smooth creamy sweetness can be noticed in the background as a distinction from their IPAs (still clearly not enough to justify its name); body is medium with moderate carbonation and the mouthfeel remains smootish regardless of the abundance of the hops. Similar to many of the Mikkeller beers, this one also escapes the genre restriction showing their overpowering love of hops. As Im not really sure what to think of it Im reviewing this simply as a beer - and overall It does very fine.

Bottle at 4:20, RBESG Rome day 3. Hazy golden orange colour, white head. Aroma is light fruity, very hoppy. Flavour is hops, grapefruity bitterness, fruity, soft light creamy malty, bitter grapefruit finish. Light bodied, smooth mouthfeel, easy drinking. Good, but a bit overhopped imo.

Draft @ Blind Tiger. First cream ale, really? Hazy golden pour with some white head. Cream, citrus,  some light butter notes. Earthy and floral hop notes as well.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2010 roof tap at 4:20 ... light haze amberm.... bubbbly white head ... soft light fruit ... lots of hop ... juicy light refreshing

Plenty of carbonation straw coloured ale aromas passionfruit caramel flavour strong grapefruit citrus peel bitter caramel smoothness spice mild dryness finish good bitter fruit and malt aftertaste decent ale

Bottled. The aroma has citric hops, some dusty yeast. Slight hazy, golden coloured beer with a big frothy, white head. The taste is bitter and citric. Some spice there. Not too much body. Light and easy going. Okay.
Tap @ Platform. Delicious hoppy nose, more akin to an american pale. Very smooth body as implied with a short bitter finish. Good for my hop needs for the night.

On tap at RattlenHum.  Light gold pour.and light aroma.  Pretty dry and hoppy for the style, pretty close to an IPA.  I might have rated it higher, but I had it in a sampler sandwiched in between Mikkellers superior IPAs.
UPDATED: FEB 2, 2012 Rerated from vandaag. Draft. Poured a golden amber with mild head. Aroma was hops, actually way creamier this time around.  Good.
Draft. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Lightly sweet aroma with toffee-like notes and herbal notes. Balanced flavor, sweet malts and herbal hops. Not bad.
The aroma is malty, hoppy, caramel, orange.  The appearance is a hazy orange, white head.  The flavor is hoppy, caramel.  The finish is grapefruit/citrus hops.  Medium in bidy.  Very good overall.
Orange with a low head. Aroma of apple vinegear, grape and grass. Citric flavour, quite dry and with some herbal notes.

Sweet, flowery yet fresh aroma. Very nice.

 A little bitter towards the end, otherwise neutrally balanced. 

 Fresh, thin, fizzy.

 Fantastic summer beer.

 Purchased at Ølbutikken.

Bottled. Slight hazy golden color, big frothy head. Hoppy aroma, earthy, bit spicy, herbal, malt. Decent bitter taste, bit earthy and herbal. Bit thin in taste. Dont know how it fits the style, but it seems to me as a bit spicy and more bittered lager beer.
33cl bottle. Pours a clear golden color with medium white head. Good lacing foam. Good hoppy aroma with erbal notes. Taste is mostly bitter with some spicy notes. Dry finish. Quite thin bodied.

Flaske: Lysgul uklar næsten wit agtig i sit udseende. Fin skumkrone. Suveræn lækker duft af tropisk frugt og citrus. Lækker frisk smag, hvor humlen er fint afbalanceret og aldrig tager overhånd. Virkelig lækker sessionbeer.

Pale straw body with lasting small white head. Aroma is bit better than the taste, seems perfumed and then fruity (citrus) whilst the taste was grassy and a  little astringent, I actually struggled with this top rating cream ale.

Short-lived, grey-shaded blond head.  Body is hazed, pale gold colored.  Delicate floral and grassy hop aroma, nice and gently balanced by a whiff  of fine, dryish malts. Taste has an  even and harmonius blend of crisp, fairly sweet malts,  with a distinct yet subtle hop addition. Properly light-bodied. Soft and easy on the palate. Rounded finish with a hoppy bite. A really lovable beer. Good to reassure that Mikkeller is able to brew top quenchable low abv beers as well.
Cloudy orange colored brew. A bit sour, citric, hops. Flavor is citric, hopped and dryhop flavor.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours golden with a slight haze and a dense - yet rough - white head. Malty nose with quite some citrus as well. Rather light in body, fruit and citrus with a slight fermentation tang. Dry and hoppy finish. Light and refreshing and probably the hoppiest Cream Ale in the world. 150410

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden pour with a foamy white head that lasts a little while. Aroma is quite hoppy and has notes of lemon, lime, passionfruit and caramel, with a hint of soap in the background. Flavour is pretty much the same as aroma but with a slightly stronger malt profile. Dry, creamy mouthfeel with moderately high carbonation and a long bitter finish. Pretty good overall, not exactly what I was expecting but a nice surprise anyway.
Pours light cloudy with a white head. Aroma is malty, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, grapefruit and light grassy notes.

Bottle. Creamy white good fully lasting head. Cloudy yellow colour. Light malty and heavy hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter almost harsh flavor. Strong grape notes. Long powerfull biterr finish. Oily palate and a little fizzy.

Bottle from Bierkoning. Light orange body with large head. Nose of fruits and grapefruit. Really refreshing taste of fruits, then citrus kicks in and bitter finish. Really, really enjoyable. Another Mikkeller master.

First time a tried this beer i found it some kind a crossing between Drinkin the sun and American Dream... and that was not a bad combi at all. The pour is mid summer straw yellow with a nice white crown. The nose is somehow fruity with an exotic touch. Some banana and this star fruit that I never figured out the use for, some sweet citric fruits as mandarins toped with some hops and vanilla. The taste is fresh with a body that is volumeous but at the same time very smooth and drinkable. Its a perfect summer beer. The finish is tempered with a light burning bitterness.

Pours a non-seethrough amber/orange with a white foam that does not last.
The nose has hops, apple, hyldebær, lime.
The taste is much like the aroma plus some peaches.

Bottle 330ml.Clear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted, moderate to light light heavy hoppy, grapefruit peel, fruity, apricots. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, bitterness is peel bitter, peppery finish. Body is medium, texture is oily and smooth, carbonation is soft. [20100313]

On tap at the Blind Tiger for their Mikkeller single hop event.  Pours a milky hazy gold with a medium sized white head.  Creamy light citrus.  Hoppy, medium bodied and smooth.  Some marshmallow, and lightly sweet Styrofoam and packing peanuts on the finish.

Its a hazy golden beer with a white, creamy and lasting head. The aroma has notes of citrus, peach and other fruits, and the same goes for the slightly sweet flavour, that has a dry, refreshing bitterness. I forget to mention the malt, but its there, even if subdued. I like this beer, but when I open a cream ale, I expect something much less hoppier and somewhat softer.

Cloudy yellow color with a fluffy white head. Aroma has some light bitterness, clean hops. Flavor is semi-creamy with light bitter hops. Nice rich body for a light cream ale. Little bitter finish, very drinkable and refreshing.

Bottle from De Bierkoning. Hazy golden, white head. Piney hop aroma. Very bitter, lots of pine and herbal hops. Even some citrus. A very good pale ale, emphasising hops, weak malty balance. Dont know about the cream ale designation, though.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2010 Draft.  Pours  white golden hazy body with a white head.  Floral citrus notes, light earth y bitterness.  Dry woody with some light bitter hop resins, the finish is bone drying and a bit unappealing.  Aroma is nice but the flavor drops off. 
Second time i had this i put it at a 3.2.  Ill keep the original score.
tap at Blind Tiger: pours hazy pale orange. sweet caramel malts and finishes very dry, strange but decent. not bad but odd.
Bottle. Blonde, hazy. Lemon and toffee in  the aroma. Firmly hopped flavor, oily and earthy with loads of citrus. Earthy bitter aftertaste. Sharp mouthfeel.

(Bottle) Golden yellow colour with frothy, white head. Fruity nose with citrus, grass and fresh hops. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, apricots and grassy hops in a dry, fresh finish. Rather light body. Elegant and tasty with a fresh, hoppy bitterness. Nice collaboration.

Hazy orange colour, mediumsized white creamy head. Aroma is grass, fruits and some mild maltyness as well. Flavour is quite similar. Rather dry and very bitter.

On Draught at Tap & Table in Emmaus. I am shocked to be the first American to review this beer. Pours a light yellow with little head. Nose is strong with sweet ketones almost sugar like. First sip is hoppy with pilsner type matls present. The Hop profile is citrus like (cumquat).  Slightly creamy big body finish. Nice Beer.
Aroma floreale , colore giallo oro . Un sapore carico di amaro che nel complesso rende questa birra molto beverina.
Bottle. Pours an unclear, dark amber beer with an offwhite head. The aroma is sweet and fruit. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweet and overall this beer is very sweet.

Draught at Bishops Arms, MalmöHazy blond color; small but creamy head. Strange aroma, it doesnt smell fresh, but there is some hop, lightly fruity, hay, milk. Strong toffee flavor, immediately aggressed by powerful bitterness with a clear grassy touch; well drinkable and pleasant, for hop lovers.

Draught at Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm.  Hazy golden, minimal head. Rich perfumy lychee aroma. Dry and light bodied with crisp, rounded mouthfeel. Lightly bready with lots of gooseberry and lychee. Marked biterness. A nice APA.

Bottled. 
Hazy golden with cottony head. Rich hop nose, with notes of grapey/citrusy hops, and bit of flowers too. Not style-like here. Aggressive hop flavour thats citrusy, with a very dry follow up. The beer seem to be over attenuated. Really not true to style here since we have the motherload of hops here.
33 cl bottle. Hazy yellow body with medium size white head. Flavour is malt, watery and fruit.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden coloured with a nice egg white lacing head. Aromas of floral hops, peach and grass. Fruity flavour with notes of lemon and spruce. Nice dry and bitter finish.
Bottle. Low fluffy white lasting head. Hazy dark yellow body. Powerful hops aroma with oranges and lemon. Heavily carbonated oranges lemon piny nut flavor with a long aftertaste.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is hazy golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, malt and herbs. Nice and mild, yet with a good lasting bitter finish.
Cloudy golden with a small white head. Hoppy aroma with lemon peel, herbs and flowers. Sweetish fruity flavour, especially lime. Too much flavour to be a true cream ale, I guess, but who cares?

330ml bottle (4:20, Rome)
Fairly fruity hoppy aroma. Pleasant carbonation, crisp hoppy palate. I feel like Ive had mikkeller beers like this a dozen times before under different names. There is some creaminess to the palate once or twice. Perhaps heading towards boring hoppy lopsidedness, but the balance it pretty good. Any hoppier, and Id have started marking this down, it was already beyond Annas threshold, I think.
Bottle @ Odense Tasting. Thanks Sfhodense. Pours hazy yellow with a small creamy lasting head and lacings. Heavy citrussy hop nose. Some weed and skunk. Very fresh. Medium bodied. Ends dry.
33cl, new exclusive brew Anno 2009, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, yet easy to drink, balanced, cloudy, good head, nice brew
giallo oro, leggermente velata,shiuma bianca fine e persistente,intenso profumo di luppolo,molto amara ma nel complesso equilibrata e gradevolissima da bere a litri

33ml bottle from DK. Pours a cloudy yellow with a thick white frothy head. Sweet fruity aroma with peach and hoppy notes. hoppy flavour with malty, grapefruit and piney notes. Finish is bitter and dry. A bit overly bitter in the finish to be really enjoyable.

Bottled. Pours iout in a very hazy dark golden colour with a small creamy white foam. Rounded hoppy aroma of grass, flowers, peaches and grapefruit-rind. Medium-bodied with notes of apricots, wet grass and lemon-zest. Medium-bitter finish of grass, pine, flowers and grapefruit-rind.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2010 Pours hazy golden with a cream white head. Aroma and flavour are nicely hoppy. good bitterness and dry finish. high drinkability!

(Bottle at Pikkulintu) Poure pale golde and hazy with medium sized and white head. Aroma contained fruitiness and citricness. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, citricness, grain, lightly sweetness and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter.
Yellow coloured and hazy. Has a white head, mostly lasting. Aroma is mainly hoppy, perfume, grapefruit, lime. Light sweet flavor, finish heavy bitter. Dry texture. soft carbonation

Sleightly hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma holds notes of peach and mandarine from some delicate hops. Flavor is fresh with a very smooth hop bitterness that almost seem sweet when combined with the mouth aroma. The body is quite thin but the finish kinda makes up for it with a decent bitterness. Great for the style

moderat malty, light golden,white foam, cloudy body, medium bitterness, light to medium body, fizzy, astringent, I like the beer.

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2010 Bottle. Little cloudy light yellow with a big white cap.  The aroma is delicate hoppy and fruity, peaches, apricots, melon, with a citrus note i would say. The body is medium/light very balanced and a delicate malt aroma with a consistent carbonation that makes it very refreshing and soft on the roof of the mouth. More bitter and dry than creamy finish, afterall i really liked this beer!

courtesy of Jespr - cloudy orange colour with a persistent creamy pale beige foam; slightly dusty with a subtle fruity hoppiness (litchies and pineapple); velvety mouthfeel, light sweetness and a medium malt backbone, low bitterness and a long aftertaste of pear and litchies along with some yeasty tones - subtle

(Bottled) Hazy light golden with a large, firm head. Aroma of citrusy hops and pale malt. Flavor is quite strongly hoppy for the style, with biscuity maltiness, and citrusy tones dominating. Almost medium body, soft carbonation, quite refreshing palate. A quite nice, citrusy session beer.

Bottle, 5.0%. Mild malty aroma, hint of flowery hops. Cloudy yellow colour. Small white head. The flavour is a bit papery, seems like Nelson Sauvin, which I never think I will learn to love. Good bitterness, slightly rough, nicely clean. A bit of melon/lemon in the finish.

Bottled. Yellow/golden coloured. Unclear. Fluffy off white head. Citrus, grass, spice and light pine in the aroma. Flavour of flowers, grape, sweetness, spice and herbs. Medium to full bodied. Dry. Grapis bitterness in the end. Quite refreshing.

Bottle, bought @ Ølbutikken, Cph.
Pale hazy golden with a medium, frothy, staying, white head. Very hoppy aroma, grassy, flowery, fruity. Peach, grapefruit, light pepper. Some caramel hops and a milky feel. High carbonation, lovely dry mouthfeel. Flavour is relatively sweet on the bottom. Lots of hops, good dryness. Fruity again, some pine, some grapefruit. Good, but is this really a cream ale.

Draft... A hazy golden beer with a cream colored head. The aroma has notes citus, malt, and lacto acid. The flsvor is sweet with notes of lemon and malt as well as lighter notes of straw and lacto acid, leading to a dry and bitter finish.

Bottle at home. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a diminishing white head. Smells hoppy. Slightly bitter with some fruity sweetness. Strong hoppy aromas. Sugary hopsaromas. Also some grape-fruits. Nelson? Medium to light bodied. Medium to high carbonation.

Draught. >Pours a hazy nice golden colour with a medium white ok lasting head. Fruity hoppy pleasant citrus aroma. Good mouthfeel indded. Fruity flavour with citrus, bitter hops and some exotic fruit. Dry and bitter fruity well alsting finish. Cream ale.... a quite hoppy version thgen.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a medium off white head. Light dusty aroma with fruity hoppy notes. Lots of citrus in here. The flavour is peaches, citrussy hops and light plastic. It ends up bitter hoppy.

Cloudy yellopw with a medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma with maily peach along with malty and hoppy notes. hoppy flavour with malty, grapefruit and piney notes. Finished bitter and dry. High drinkabilty.

cloudy yellow, small smooth white head.
very nice floraly hoppy arom with citrussy tones, fresh.
flavor is dry, hoppy, hoppy bitter, faint malts, tastes like it was stronger.
